sentences.sContent: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.sContent_eng: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.sCn: 据信它能抑制一种能在肿瘤中促进细胞增殖的酶的生成。

sentences.sContent: This enzyme accumulates in the larvae to a level where it becomes toxic and kills them.
sentences.sContent_eng: This enzyme accumulates in the larvae to a level where it becomes toxic and kills them.
sentences.sCn: 这种酶在幼虫体内积累到一定浓度，就会变得有毒并杀死它们。

sentences.sContent: Apparently, though, CYP2E1 affects how sensitive the brain is to alcohol, perhaps because it —unlike the enzyme in the liver —generates free radicals, tiny molecules that can damage cells.
sentences.sContent_eng: Apparently, though, CYP2E1 affects how sensitive the brain is to alcohol, perhaps because it —unlike the enzyme in the liver —generates free radicals, tiny molecules that can damage cells.
sentences.sCn: 虽然表面上是这样，CYP2E1却影响着大脑对酒精的敏感度，或许因为它—不像在肝脏中的酶—产生了自由基，能损害细胞的微小分子。

phrases.pCn: 酶联免疫吸附测定，酶标法
蛋白酶；蛋白水解酶；解朊酶

trans.tranOther: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal
